item.title: Authorizing the Yammer JS SDK
item.description: Under normal circumstances, users will have to create a Yammer session before using the JS SDK in scenarios like apps integrated on intranet pages. If you’re able to implement both server and client side scripting and pull the current user’s email address, you can use this guide to preauthorize a Yammer session so apps utilizing the JS SDK will be as seamless as possible. Prerequisites and Assumptions You have created an app in Yammer and properly configured the JavaScript Origins You have an app utilizing the Yammer JS SDK with users manually authenticating as per our documentation at https://developer.
